decks.notes: The deck's main focus is to quickly ramp up mana and creatures using cards like Allosaurus Rider and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant, and then use Eldritch Evolution, Neoform, and Planar Genesis to search for and put powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield. The deck also includes cards like Pact of Negation and Consign to Memory to protect and control the game state while setting up the combos. The inclusion of Boseiju, Who Endures helps to ensure that important spells like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform resolve without being countered.

The deck focuses on combining Eldrazi creatures with ramp spells and control elements to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. By utilizing cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and Ugin, Eye of the Storms, the deck can dominate the board while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The ramp provided by Eldrazi Temple and Utopia Sprawl allows for explosive plays early in the game, while Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command help control the board. Overall, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and control the game until it can secure a victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay using a combination of powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco along with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt. The Leyline cards provide additional support by boosting the power of multicolored creatures while Arena of Glory helps to keep up the pressure on opponents. Teferi, Time Raveler and Stubborn Denial offer protection and disruption, allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive tempo. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with a mix of threats and disruption.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays while also disrupting your opponent's game plan. By utilizing efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and powerful spells like Consign to Memory and Prismatic Ending, you can apply pressure while controlling the board. Quantum Riddler and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional disruption, making it difficult for your opponent to execute their strategy. With a mix of creatures, removal spells, and disruption, this deck aims to quickly establish dominance and prevent your opponent from stabilizing.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent, while also utilizing Leyline cards to enhance the board state. It also includes control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Stubborn Denial to protect its threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of efficient creatures, removal spells, and disruptive elements, taking advantage of its multicolored cards to create a versatile and powerful aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's plays through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. By utilizing cards like Force of Negation, Unholy Heat, and Subtlety, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up its own win conditions. Additionally, the inclusion of Mishra's Bauble and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps to generate card advantage and filter through the deck. The deck's mana base allows for flexibility in casting spells from all three colors, ensuring that the control elements are well-supported.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By using versatile cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Quantum Riddler, along with removal spells like Consign to Memory and Prismatic Ending, the deck can apply pressure while also dealing with threats efficiently. Additionally, cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Ephemerate provide additional value and flexibility in combat situations. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while presenting a quick clock to close out the game.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive threats like Monastery Swiftspear and Slickshot Show-Off, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. The deck also includes card draw and filtering effects like Expressive Iteration and Mishra's Bauble to maintain momentum and find key pieces. The goal is to apply constant pressure on the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to ramp up mana quickly and cast powerful colorless Eldrazi creatures and Planeswalkers. It utilizes control elements like removal spells (Dismember, Warping Wail), hand disruption (Thought-Knot Seer), and board wipes (All Is Dust) to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain board control. Karn, the Great Creator can also shut down artifact-based strategies while also providing utility. Overall, the deck aims to overpower opponents with big threats and efficient removal while controlling the game tempo.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Amulet Titan combo, which involves utilizing Primeval Titan to fetch utility lands like Urza's Saga, Boseiju, and The Mycosynth Gardens to generate powerful board presence and ramp quickly into game-winning threats. The deck also includes tools like Scapeshift and Gruul Turf to efficiently dig for key pieces and ensure a strong late-game engine. With the right sequence of plays and proper utilization of mana, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with explosive plays and resilient threats.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive plays using Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes various Eldrazi cards like Thought-Knot Seer, Sire of Seven Deaths, and Glaring Fleshraker to quickly put pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Kozilek's Command and Ugin's Labyrinth to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck has a land base that supports the Eldrazi theme with Eldrazi Temple and Cavern of Souls, along with other utility lands like Ghost Quarter and Wastes.

This Modern Ruby Storm deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana through spells like Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual, while leveraging the cost reduction provided by Ruby Medallion to cast powerful storm spells such as Grapeshot. The deck also includes cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Wish to help find key combo pieces or answer threats. By chaining together spells and generating a high storm count, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of burn spells for a decisive victory.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly and efficiently, utilizing cards like Manamorphose, Desperate Ritual, and Pyretic Ritual to accelerate the game. It also includes various card draw and selection spells like Artist's Talent, Reckless Impulse, and Wish to find key combo pieces. The end goal is to cast Ral, Monsoon Mage and combine his abilities with cards like Ruby Medallion and Wrenn's Resolve to deal massive damage to the opponent quickly. Past in Flames allows for spells to be recast from the graveyard, adding resilience to the combo.

This deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures to combo off and generate value through sacrificing and recurring creatures. The key strategy involves using cards like Chord of Calling to search for specific creatures, such as Cauldron Familiar and Samwise Gamgee, and using sacrifice outlets like Viscera Seer to trigger their abilities. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Endurance to disrupt opponents' strategies. By utilizing a mix of sacrifice outlets, creature tutors, and resilient creatures, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures and powerful enchantments to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The strategy is to play aggressively with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, while controlling the board with spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial. Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact provide additional support by locking down opponents' creatures and buffing your own, while cards like Consign to Memory offer versatility in dealing with threats. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to maintain pressure and control the game through a mix of creatures and enchantments.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to play small, efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, combined with cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Expressive Iteration and Mishra's Bauble to ensure consistency. By running a low curve and focusing on aggressive plays, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly before they have a chance to stabilize.
